intro: Zederbauera echinella, commonly known as the spiny zederbauera, is a rare and distinctive plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves and clusters of small, white flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its unique morphology and limited distribution make it a subject of interest for botanists and conservationists. Due to habitat loss, it is considered endangered in many regions.
